how_to_help.question: How can I support the site?

answers.item1: Spread the word to get more players here!
answers.item2: Contribute to website development, enhancement, bug fixes, or maintenance via <github_link>GitHub</github_link>
answers.item3: Monetary donations - see the Donating to Hivegame.com section of the FAQ

how_to_get_crown.question: Why do some users have the ðŸ‘‘ symbol next to their name?
how_to_get_crown.answer: Users who make a voluntary and optional monetary donation to support Hivegame.com get a crown symbol next to their name. Besides, the symbol next to their name, donors get no additional privileges.

what_is_hive.question: What is Hive?
what_is_hive.answer: Hive is a fast-paced, abstract strategy game played with hexagonal tiles. Think of it as chess... with bugs. And remember: always protect your Queen. You can buy a physical set of Hive from the website of the publisher <gen42_link>Gen42</gen42_link>

hive_rules.question: What are the rules of Hive?
hive_rules.answer: Each player takes turns placing or moving tiles with the goal of surrounding the opponent's queen bee. The full rules are <rules_link>here in PDF form</rules_link> or if you prefer a video, you can check out a <video_link>short YouTube video here</video_link>.

expansions_supported.question: Which expansions are supported?
expansions_supported.answer: All three official ones: Mosquito: Copies abilities of adjacent bugs. Ladybug: Moves exactly 2 steps on top of the hive, 1 step down. Pillbug: Tosses adjacent pieces once per turn.

resign_ok.question: Is it alright to resign a game I'm sure of losing?
resign_ok.answer: Yes. Just like in chess, it's totally okay to concede a match without playing it to conclusion on the board if you think you've no chance of victory.

signup_required.question: Can I play without signing up?
signup_required.answer: No. But creating an account is free and simple.

mobile_friendly.question: Is it mobile friendly?
mobile_friendly.answer: Absolutely. Hivegame.com runs smoothly on mobile, tablet, and desktop. Just beware of slippery fingers mid-match.

mobile_app.question: Is there a mobile app?
mobile_app.answer: Not yet. Hivegame.com is available as a progressive web app. just add it to your mobile home screen for an app-like experience.

profile_navigation.question: How do I navigate to my Profile Page?
profile_navigation.answer: When logged in, click on your username on the top right of the screen to go to the Profile Page.

game_types.question: Are games correspondence or real-time?
game_types.answer: Hivegame.com supports both. You can play a live match or revisit your tab hours later, based on the time settings used while setting up a game.

start_game.question: How do I start a game?
start_game.answer: On the home page, click one of the six Time Control settings to start a game or the 'custom' button to choose different settings.

time_controls.question: What do the Time Control settings on the home page mean?
time_controls.answer: The time control settings dictate the game speed. To illustrate, 3+3 means that when the game starts each person is allotted a total of 3 minutes. When on turn, time begins to countdown. When a turn is completed, 3 seconds are added to the time available as at end of turn. All other time formats work similarly.

realtime_vs_correspondence.question: What's the difference between Real time, Correspondence, Untimed Games?
realtime_vs_correspondence.answer: Real time games are to be finished within the time settings chosen so typically requires both players to be online simultaneously. Correspondence games are generally spread over several days or with at least 1 move every x days. If you do not play your move within the time, you will forfeit the game. Untimed games are self-explanatory.

casual_vs_rated.question: What's Casual vs. Rated games?
casual_vs_rated.answer: You can choose to have your game rated (Glicko-2 system) and thereby get an estimate of your proficiency and track progression over time. Newcomers start with a rating of 1500. In general, winning increases your rating, losing a game decreases your rating. Higher rating implies higher proficiency. Winning games vs. much lower-ranked opponents does not increase your rating materially. But winning games vs. a higher-ranked opponent can bump up your rating significantly. Winning or losing Casual games has no effect on your rating. Reminder: Rated games are only available if all three expansions are used (MLP format).

base_vs_mlp.question: What's Base vs. MLP format?
base_vs_mlp.answer: MLP is the default competitive setup and uses the Mosquito, Ladybug, and Pillbug (aka MLP) pieces. Base game does not have these 3 bugs.

private_vs_public.question: What's private vs. public?
private_vs_public.answer: A public game is available on the home page for any other player to join. A private game provides you a link that you can send another player.

rating_range.question: What's the rating range?
rating_range.answer: This setting allows only opponents within a specific range variation of your rating to accept the match. This ensures that you can choose opponents who are as close (or not!) to your rating as per your preference.

color_selection.question: What's the White, Random, Black hexagon?
color_selection.answer: When you're setting up a game, you choose whether you want to start as White, Black, or as randomly determined by the system.

spectate_games.question: Can I spectate games?
spectate_games.answer: Yes! Ongoing real-time games are visible on the home page. Click any to spectate.

turn_alerts.question: Will I get an alert when it's my turn (for turn-based games)?
turn_alerts.answer: Yes, you will see a red message icon at the top of the page with a number indicating how many games you are on turn. Alternatively, navigate to your Profile Page and you can filter for currently Playing, Unstarted Tournament, and Finished games.

correspondence_notifications.question: Can I get notified when it's my turn to play in a correspondence game?
correspondence_notifications.answer: You can connect your discord account to your Hivegame.com profile and receive notifications from the busybee bot. Click on your profile button at the top-right corner and click on 'Edit Account'

chat_basics.question: How does the chat work?
chat_basics.answer: The chat feature is very much a work in progress; we are aware it has issues, so important things to keep in mind when using it: 1. Currently the chat does not persist in the database so whenever we deploy an update your chat messages will be lost! 2. For now, it is only possible to chat in a game (direct messages and other ways will be added in the future), spectators don't see the player chat, nor do the players see the spectator chat. 3. Sometimes the red chat notification will show new messages when there aren't any.

tournament_entry.question: Can anyone join a tournament? Is there an entry fee? What about prizes?
tournament_entry.answer: Yes, you can join a tournament even if you're a beginner. However, some tournaments may be restricted by rating or could be invitation-only as decided by the tournament organizer. As of this writing, there are no entry fees and no prizes (apart from bragging rights and rating points increases!)

tournament_duration.question: What's the duration of a tournament? How many games? How do I coordinate schedules?
tournament_duration.answer: The tournament page should typically outline all these details. If you've any questions, please contact the tournament organizer. Currently, only Round-Robin tournaments are available, but more formats will be added soon.

tournament_stats.question: In a tournament results table, what's H2H, WB, SB, Finished?
tournament_stats.answer: H2H - Head 2 Head record, which is the first tie-break criteria. WB - Win as Black, which is the second tie-break criteria. SB - Sonnebron-Berger Score, which is the third tie-break criteria. Finished - number of finished games.

tournament_games.question: Where do I see my in-progress / yet-to-be-started games?
tournament_games.answer: Navigate to your profile page and you will see filters to your currently Playing and Unstarted Tournament Games.

change_password.question: How do I change my password?
change_password.answer: Navigate to profile > Edit Account or <edit_link>use this link</edit_link>

move_confirmation.question: What do the different Move Confirmation modes mean?
move_confirmation.answer: When making a move there are 3 modes: 1. Single click - The fast one: if you do not want to lose time in fast games. Be careful not to misplace or wrongly move the piece as a single click immediately makes & confirms the move. 2. Double click - The default one: the first click to place / move the piece and the second click confirms the move. 3. Clock confirm - The secure one: first click to place / move and then to confirm the move, you click on your own timer. Double click or Clock confirm modes are recommended.

game_analysis.question: Can I review finished games with an analysis tool?
game_analysis.answer: Yes, finished games have a microscope icon that will load the game into analysis mode but this feature is currently under development, so don't expect too much yet.

play_bots.question: Can I play against a bot?
play_bots.answer: Yes, click the button 'Play Bot' on the homepage and select the bot you want to play against. An untimed game will immediately start.

community_forum.question: Is there a community forum?
community_forum.answer: Yes! Join the World Hive Community Discord server <discord_link>here</discord_link> - full of friendly players and strategy talk.

report_bugs.question: Where can I report bugs or suggest new features?
report_bugs.answer: Join the Hivegame.com Discord server <discord_link>here</discord_link> and you can message the developers using the channels therein.

get_better.question: How do I get better at Hive?
get_better.answer: Check out the <resources_link>Resources Section</resources_link> of the site for a curated list of resources to get started.

play_specific_players.question: Can I play with a specific player?
play_specific_players.answer: Of course! You can use the crossed swords icon next to a player's name to challenge them directly. Alternatively create a private game (click the 'custom' button on the homepage) and share the link privately. Only a player with the link can join.

donation_amount.question: What's the recommended donation amount?
donation_amount.answer: All donations, big and small, help to keep Hivegame.com running and are gratefully received. Considering credit card and bank transaction charges, a donation of minimum EUR 5 is suggested.

how_donate.question: How do I Donate?
how_donate.answer: Click on Donate in the navigation bar or <donate_link>use this link</donate_link>

how_to_check_stack.question: How do I see what's under a tile?
how_to_check_stack.answer: Right-click or long press (on mobile) a stacked tile to expand it. You'll see the tile(s) underneath while you hold.

can_i_play_base_game.question: Can I play without expansions?
can_i_play_base_game.answer: Yes. You can toggle if expansions are used when creating a game, and playing without expansions is good for beginners! Rated games are only available if expansions are used, as it's the official competitive format.

opponent_is_abusive.question: What can I do if my opponent is abusive or disruptive in game/chat or has an inappropriate username, what can I do?
opponent_is_abusive.answer: Screenshot the behaviour and contact us via Discord @klautcomputing / @ionoi we will sort it out.

why_elo_has_questionmark.question: Why is there a ? next to my rating?
why_elo_has_questionmark.answer: A ? next to your rating indicates that your rating is provisional i.e., you should expect a higher volatility in ratings till you've played a statistically significant number of games for the system to determine your rating with higher accuracy.

why_not_in_top_players.question: Why do I not show up in the top ranked players?
why_not_in_top_players.answer: You haven't played enough games yet for the system to be really sure how accurate your rating is. Just keep playing a couple games more, hopefully win them and you will show up.

how_to_recover_password.question: I forgot my password! What now?
how_to_recover_password.answer: Send a mail to leex@klautcomputing.de from the same email address that you use on Hivegame.com requesting for a password reset.

can_i_set_up_a_tournament.question: Can I start my own tournament?
can_i_set_up_a_tournament.answer: Yes! Just click on Create Tournament and the rest should be self-explanatory.
